page.title: 01WOOLSTON/THELWALL/STATHAM
page.content:
The area covered by our survey is divided by{The Manchester Ship Canal (and{The River Mersey})running from the S.W. to the N.E.. It is also cut through from N. to S. by the{M6 {Motorway}and its notorious{Thelwall {Viaduct.
There are three large sectors of housing; Woolston in the N., Statham in the S.E., and Thelwall in the S.W..
The Woolston area might best be called working class while the two areas in the south could be seen as middle or upper working class.
The land in between is most unusual. Known as the{The Eyes,}it is desolate and occupied only by birds and other wildlife.
